title: Fustibalus
data:
***Obsolete**: This article refers to an aspect of the game which has been removed. It is retained for historical reference only.*

| Name                                           | Fustibalus                 |
| :--------------------------------------------- | -------------------------- |
| Skill                                          | [Slings](/Slings "Slings") |
| [Damage](/Weapon_damage "Weapon damage")       | 10                         |
| Accuracy                                       | -1                         |
| [Base delay](/Weapon_speed "Weapon speed") (%) | 14 (140%)                  |
| [Min delay](/Minimum_delay "Minimum delay")    | 7 at skill 14              |
| [Hands](/Handedness "Handedness")              | 1H                         |
| Size                                           | Little                     |
| Ranged?                                        | Yes                        |

|   |                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
| - | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
|   | A length of wood with a reinforced sling at one end, able to fire projectiles at high velocity. It deals more damage when launching purpose-made ammunition, rather than stones found on the floor. |

> This weapon falls into the 'Slings' category. It is a one-handed weapon.

The **fustibalus** is a significantly more powerful option than a [hunting sling](/Hunting_sling "Hunting sling"), requiring slightly more skill and time per shot, but dealing much more damage per hit. Although less devastating than its two-handed [bow](/Bows "Bows") and [crossbow](/Crossbows "Crossbows") counterparts, they require much less skill to reach min-delay, and a well-enchanted fustibalus can still be an effective and deadly end-game weapon. Base damage is 12 when firing sling bullets. Even so, be aware that it may still have some difficulty taking down [hell sentinels](/Hell_sentinel "Hell sentinel") and other late-game high-[AC](/AC "AC") opponents.

|                          | Image                                                                     |
| ------------------------ | ------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Mundane**              | [![Fustibalus.png](/images/9/97/Fustibalus.png)](/File:Fustibalus.png)    |
| **Magical**              | [![Fustibalus2.png](/images/1/13/Fustibalus2.png)](/File:Fustibalus2.png) |
| **Artifact**             | [![Fustibalus3.png](/images/8/8a/Fustibalus3.png)](/File:Fustibalus3.png) |
|                          | [Unrandarts](/Unrandart "Unrandart")                                      |
| **[Punk](/Punk "Punk")** | [![Urand punk.png](/images/e/ec/Urand_punk.png)](/File:Urand_punk.png)    |

## History

- Fustibali were removed with the [Slings skill](/Slings_\(skill\) "Slings (skill)") in [0.29](/0.29 "0.29"). Punk became a greatsling again.
- Prior to [0.19](/0.19 "0.19"), the item was called greatsling and was a two handed weapon for [spriggans](/Spriggan "Spriggan").
- It was added in [0.15](/0.15 "0.15").

| [Polearms](/Polearms "Polearms")                     | [Bardiche](/Bardiche "Bardiche") • [Demon trident](/Demon_trident "Demon trident") • [Glaive](/Glaive "Glaive") • [Halberd](/Halberd "Halberd") ([Scythe](/Scythe "Scythe")) • [Spear](/Spear "Spear") • [Trident](/Trident "Trident") • [Trishula](/Trishula "Trishula")                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |

html:
Fustibalus

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Obsolete: This article refers to an aspect of the game which has been removed. It is retained for historical reference only.
Name Fustibalus
Skill Slings
Damage 10
Accuracy -1
Base delay (%) 14 (140%)
Min delay 7 at skill 14
Hands 1H
Size Little
Ranged? Yes
A length of wood with a reinforced sling at one end, able to fire projectiles at high velocity. It deals more damage when launching purpose-made ammunition, rather than stones found on the floor.
This weapon falls into the 'Slings' category. It is a one-handed weapon.

The fustibalus is a significantly more powerful option than a hunting sling, requiring slightly more skill and time per shot, but dealing much more damage per hit. Although less devastating than its two-handed bow and crossbow counterparts, they require much less skill to reach min-delay, and a well-enchanted fustibalus can still be an effective and deadly end-game weapon. Base damage is 12 when firing sling bullets. Even so, be aware that it may still have some difficulty taking down hell sentinels and other late-game high-AC opponents.


Image
Mundane
Magical
Artifact
Unrandarts
Punk

History

  • Fustibali were removed with the Slings skill in 0.29. Punk became a greatsling again.
  • Prior to 0.19, the item was called greatsling and was a two handed weapon for spriggans.
  • It was added in 0.15.
Weapons
Axes Battleaxe • Broad axe • Executioner's axe • Hand axe • War axe
Maces & Flails Club • Demon whip • Dire flail • Eveningstar • Flail • Giant club • Giant spiked club • Great mace • Mace (Hammer) • Morningstar • Sacred scourge • Whip
Long Blades Demon blade • Double sword • Eudemon blade • Falchion • Great sword • Long sword • Scimitar • Triple sword
Polearms Bardiche • Demon trident • Glaive • Halberd (Scythe) • Spear • Trident • Trishula
Ranged Weapons Arbalest • Hand cannon • Longbow • Orcbow • Shortbow • Sling • Triple crossbow
Short Blades Dagger • Quick blade • Rapier • Short sword
Staves Lajatang • Magical staff • Quarterstaff
Throwing Boomerang • Dart • Javelin • Large rock • Stone • Throwing net

The '''fustibalus''' is a significantly more powerful option than a [[hunting sling]], requiring slightly more skill and time per shot, but dealing much more damage per hit. Although less devastating than its two-handed [[Bows|bow]] and [[Crossbows|crossbow]] counterparts, they require much less skill to reach min-delay, and a well-enchanted fustibalus can still be an effective and deadly end-game weapon. Base damage is 12 when firing sling bullets. Even so, be aware that it may still have some difficulty taking down [[hell sentinel]]s and other late-game high-[[AC]] opponents.

==History==
*Fustibali were removed with the [[Slings (skill)|Slings skill]] in [[0.29]]. Punk became a greatsling again.
*Prior to [[0.19]], the item was called greatsling and was a two handed weapon for [[spriggan]]s.
*It was added in [[0.15]].
